review_text: This little house met our needs and at a great value. We needed a one-night stop while driving our four kids (4 and under) across the country, and getting an expensive one-room hotel nearby versus this house for half the price was an easy choice. Plus, we needed a full-size fridge and a kitchen since we don’t eat out when traveling, and it worked out quite well. Just note that, in the summer at least, the separate bedrooms do not cool down unless you open the doors (the air-con unit is in the main room only), although Renee did have good high-powered fans available in each room. The main bed (where we slept) was quite comfortable, though, and we weren’t bothered at all by the unshuttered small windows near the roof, like some reviews have mentioned. We slept very well! Thanks, Renee!

If you’re just stopping to sleep then this is definitely a good, affordable option! We never felt unsafe and had all of our basic needs.
If you’re sensitive to light, however, something I would take into consideration is that it was pretty bright in the first bedroom. So, if you are trying to sleep in, it may be difficult. Also, the other rooms do not seem to have AC circulation. However, there were plenty of fans to make up for this (and clocks, quite literally everywhere— which we thought was funny).
There are 2 main beds: One queen, one full sized. There’s also an air mattress (we didn’t attempt to use this), and a sofa bed that was unfortunately broken so we kept it folded. Because of this I would say it sleeps maybe 4-5 depending on whether you have small children that could comfortably share a full sized bed.
Since we are a 4 person family, we made use of the sofa-bed as just a sofa and were able to sleep everyone and enjoy our stay!

Linda’s home was amazing.
We were in town for a family reunion and found this Gem. 💎
Lots of parking, easy to find, easy to get in.
The landscaping was beautiful. Plenty of space for the activities provided like grilling, corn hole and lounging.
The inside was very nice. Clean linens, a fun cohesive theme. There were items for everything. This home was fully stocked. I’ve stayed in Airbnbs all over the world and this was by far the best stocked Airbnb I’ve been in.
The living space was comfy. My group loved the giant Tic tac toe game. The beds were very comfy and the linens were fresh.
There was a thunderstorm while I was in town and the host reached out to us before it even started to ensure we were situated and to give details for an emergency plan should we need it. We didn’t need it and the carport provided great shelter to watch the lightening.
All in all. When I come back to town I will stay here. I wouldn’t even look for another spot.
10/10 great stay

The first time we booked as an overnight stop on a road trip in March and we’re caught off guard at how much enjoyed the serenity/isolation/charm. We had hoped to take advantage of the pool, but it was just too cold at that time. We said that if we ever were in the area that we’d come back for more than a night and when it was warmer.
There had been quite a few upgrades since our first stay two years ago (a much more impressive patio area equipped with a tv to Netflix while kids played in the pool, grill area that had gas coal and a blackstone AND a hot tub). Needless to say, we took full advantage.
Sandi and Jon are great hosts. Warm, welcoming, and easy to communicate. The fresh eggs are also a nice touch.
